title: India tweaks gas procurement norms for fertiliser firms to cut costs
summary: India has modified its gas procurement policy for fertiliser companies, enabling them to purchase approximately 20% of their monthly gas requirements through the domestic spot market. This policy change aims to reduce government subsidy expenses.
content:
NEW DELHI - India has introduced significant changes to its gas procurement policy affecting fertiliser companies, allowing them to source about 20% of their monthly gas requirements through the local spot market. The move represents a strategic shift in procurement practices aimed at reducing the government's substantial subsidy burden.

The policy adjustment comes as part of broader efforts to optimize costs in the fertiliser sector, where gas serves as a crucial raw material. Previously, fertiliser companies had more restricted procurement options, but this new flexibility could potentially lead to more cost-effective purchasing decisions.

The government sources indicate that this change is expected to result in meaningful savings on the national subsidy bill, which has been under pressure due to volatile global energy prices.

## Policy Changes in Indian Gas Procurement

India has introduced significant changes to its gas procurement policy affecting fertiliser companies, allowing them to source about 20% of their monthly gas requirements through the local spot market. The move represents a strategic shift in procurement practices aimed at reducing the government's substantial subsidy burden.

The policy adjustment comes as part of broader efforts to optimize costs in the fertiliser sector, where gas serves as a crucial raw material. Previously, fertiliser companies had more restricted procurement options, but this new flexibility could potentially lead to more cost-effective purchasing decisions.

The government sources indicate that this change is expected to result in meaningful savings on the national subsidy bill, which has been under pressure due to volatile global energy prices.
